alert.note: Alert for Butler; Montgomery; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 7:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN WARREN AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 747 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Trenton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Kettering, Middletown, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Springboro, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, Moraine, Carlisle, South Middletown, West Carrollton, Waynesville, Hunter, Williamsdale, Germantown, New Miami, Centerville, Jacksonburg and State Route 63 at State Route 741. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 31 and 36. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 28 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
